column3: The Customer Success Manager is critical to helping customers receive value from their investment in Tanium and to ensure Tanium maintains its enviable base of high value, loyal customers that rely on Tanium to manage all their endpoints. This customer facing role will be responsible for customers each having thousands of endpoints running the Tanium platform and solutions. The successful candidate will be able to manage a significant set of customers and use data and qualitative feedback to decide how best to engage resources to drive desired results. &amp

Ensure successful business outcomes for customers that lead to world-class retention and expansion for Tanium by collaborating with an account team of Sales, Solution Engineers, Domain Architects, and more&lt

Understand the unique complexity of the customers and segmentation of customers you serve and create the best path to full Tanium platform adoption and expansion, leveraging your understanding of not only the customer???s environment but also insights as to how to overcome obstacles to implement new technologies&lt
Develop and maintain the necessary relationships with customers to ensure alignment to their business needs&lt
Identify where Tanium can be further integrated into customer business processes and controls to increase ROI and expand into new solution areas&lt

Perform activities and data management that help to drive adoption and value against an agreed-upon plan with the customer. This may include artifact creation (including Value Plans for customers), action and risk tracking, and updating internal data systems such as Salesforce and/or Gainsight&lt
Contribute to strategically focused Executive Business Reviews, alongside Sales, Solution Engineers, and wider account team members&lt
Contribute proactively to internal practice development efforts to continually drive maturity and improvement of our Customer Success function&lt
Maintain a strong understanding of all aspects of the Tanium solutions and their value to customers&lt
5 plus years of experience in Customer Success, Account Management, Sales, Renewals, or Service Management / Professional Services, preferably in a SaaS business model&lt
Has demonstrated consulting and project management skills, experience with building strategic relationships that drive business value for customers&lt
Working knowledge of endpoint technology and the areas of major business outcomes for a CIO&lt

column7: ???A highly organized self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is comfortable working in ambiguity&lt
Curious, willing to learn from others in your discipline, your customers, and other roles at Tanium&lt
Willing to contribute suggestions and ideas to further customer and Tanium goals&lt
Eager to become an expert in demonstrating value and return on investment to our customers&lt
Eager to learn technology foundations and become a technical advisor on the Tanium platform and solutions.&lt
A strong communicator and intuitive listener&lt

Do you have an uncanny ability to understand customer needs and deliver solutions? Do you have technical skills along with the ability to translate those skills to any audience? At Tanium our Solution Engineering team works closely with Sales and Customer Success (CS) teams to engage current and potential customers. We drive and lead the technology evaluation stage of the sales cycle, demo the platform, and deliver comprehensive Proof of Value (POV).&lt
You will be engaged in interactive pre-sales discovery meetings, analysis of customers??? current technology and architecture, operational and business needs
column8: and the development and presentation of appropriate Tanium solutions. You will lead deep-dive technical discussions with the customer to position Tanium???s transformative enterprise operations and security platform to the relevant stakeholders, from C-level to the technology user.&lt

column11: Ideal candidate must be based in California, Oregon, Arizona or Washington. This will require 50% travel to SF Bay area.&amp

column7: Work directly with our world-class sales team from initial discovery to deal close to shorten sales cycles and improve closing rates&lt

Oversee and participate in initial discovery meetings with customers, providing platform demos and highly technical Proof of Value engagements for both existing customers and new sales opportunities&lt
Architect complex technical solutions fulfilling business requirements across IT Operations, Security, and Risk teams&lt
Be the direct conduit translating customer business challenges into technical solutions, positioning Tanium to effectively solve those challenges&lt
Function as a technical expert throughout sales engagements, ensuring that tactical motions in the pre-sales and POV processes line up with strategic account goals&lt
Prioritize and complete tasks independently on-time or ahead of schedule. Handle ambiguity well, driving towards results. Complete tasks with very little supervision&lt
Maintain extremely high level of accountability, owning projects and engagements through from initiation to completion&lt
Lead by example in partnering with field engineering teams and other business units to ensure maximum effectiveness and consistent customer experience throughout the sales process&lt
Exhibit passion to be a part of Tanium and model that attitude actively. Energetic and never failing in pursuit of success&lt

Volunteer to take responsibility for complex efforts and drive to completion. Be acknowledged as a proven leader and grow to be sought out by others for advice and mentorship. Embrace change. Understand company strategic goals and help the team achieve them&lt
Consistently and cogently address our customers??? needs through astute verbal, written, and presentation skills&lt
Build, manage and maintain strong relationships with customers, peers and partners&lt
Actively participate and speak at regional marketing events and conferences&lt
Customer-facing Sales and Channel enablement, including training&lt
Operate as a keystone in the sales model, working with the Sales, Marketing, Product, and CS organizations to continuously improve effectiveness and efficiency throughout the customer life-cycle&amp
Set and manage personal and professional goals. Mentor other team members in setting and achieving their own goals&lt
Travel expected to be 40-60% to engage with customers and prospects in person&lt
8+ years of operational and/or selling experience in endpoint operations or security&lt
4+ years of experience in customer-facing or customer support positions&lt
Significant software pre-sales or related value-based technical selling expertise in very large enterprise environments&lt
Experience presenting at multiple levels, from C-Suite to Solution Users&lt
A demonstrated track record of taking ownership of complex initiatives and producing successful outcomes&lt
Broad knowledge of the IT security, operations, and compliance space and products&lt
Deep knowledge with hands-on experience in one or more of the following:&lt
Broad knowledge of scripting languages is a plus&lt
Excellent written and verbal communication skills&lt
Naturally team-oriented with a mission-first attitude&lt
BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or equivalent experience required&lt

column3: At Tanium, our Support Manager fulfills a necessary role in our organization to serve our customers by leading a team of Support, Technical Support Engineer (TSE) in the Tanium Support Center. The Tanium Support Center is responsible for resolving technical issues and answering technical questions that customers have in a timely manner. &amp
With a primary focus on customer satisfaction, Support Managers ensure that their team is continually working to improve the overall experience of our customers when using Tanium.&amp

column7: Build and manage a team by:&lt
Coaching TSEs to ensure the Support Center is delivering effective, timely, and professional customer support&lt
Managing team performance with a focus on goal-centric performance management&lt
Monitoring appropriate customer focused metrics and making adjustments as needed to ensure organizational goals are being met&lt
Ensuring the voice of the customer is being heard by providing and facilitating feedback to the Engineering teams on how we can improve the overall customer experience&lt
Keeping product quality improvement as a key focus of the team by encouraging product feedback&lt
Working with technical writers to ensure support cases and questions are converted into customer facing documentation allowing for self-service&lt
Engaging with customers both proactively and reactively to ensure the optimum customer satisfaction is being met&lt
Facilitating 24x7 support by ensuring appropriate follow-the-sun support and hand-offs occur&lt
Associate degree or equivalent experience required&lt
BS degree in Computer Science, MIS, or similar experience a plus&lt
5+ years of experience as a manager or manager of managers in a software support organization.&lt

column3: Tanium is looking for an experienced manager to oversee and enhance our Partner Sales Enablement program. With the rapid expansion of our Partner program, this role is essential to ensure partners are equipped with the knowledge and skills to identify opportunities and routes to market for Tanium solutions worldwide. This position is perfect for a versatile individual with experience in both direct and channel sales enablement. The ideal candidate is energetic and ready to tackle challenges to achieve goals.&lt

column9: This is a hybrid position, which will require in person attendance several days each week in one of the following locations: Addison, TX

column3: Collaborate with key stakeholders to define and develop a Partner Sales Enablement strategy that aligns with both global and regional business plans&lt
Create, refine, and guide enablement materials with a sales-focused approach tailored to different partner personas and types&lt
Work with Tanium Partner Sales leaders to deliver onsite Seller-focused enablement for designated strategic partners&lt
Lead the sales tracks within Tanium Partner Academies&lt
Build relationships with Tanium and Partner Sales leadership&lt
You will employ various techniques, such as assessments and role plays, to validate readiness and ensure effective knowledge transfer&lt
Monitor, measure and report on the effectiveness of program investments&lt
Collaborate closely with members of the Global Enablement team to leverage best practices, programs and execution on a global scale&lt
Listen, collect and apply feedback from both internal and external sellers to continually improve the program&lt
Constantly evaluate and refine partner enablement approach based on business needs and industry best practices&lt
Establish benchmark reporting criteria aligned to partner success metrics&lt
5-7 years IT industry experience, preferably in an OEM or Channel environment&lt
Strength in collaboration and teamwork, project and program management, organizational and problem-solving skills, and leadership&lt
Leverages input, contribution and execution from cross-functional teams to get results&lt
Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing environment&lt
Strong presentation and verbal communication skills
Professional and concise communications (written/verbal), presentation and facilitation skills&lt
Must be able to use consultative approach and persuasive communication with stakeholders&lt
Ability to take initiative and to set priorities independently and work under deadlines and specific time frames&lt
Proven ability to lead the development of a full training cycle (assess needs, identify learning outcomes and success criteria, plan, develop, coordinate, assess, and evaluate)&lt

column3: Tanium???s Customer Success function is critical to helping customers receive value from their investment in Tanium and to ensure Tanium maintains its enviable base of high value, loyal customers that rely on Tanium to manage all their endpoints. The RVP, Customer Success role leads a team that is responsible for each customer???s success by leveraging best practices and their technical expertise to ensure adoption of the Tanium platform, leading to renewal and upsell opportunities for their assigned accounts.&lt
Lead, Mentor, and Scale: Motivate and inspire a team of Customer Success team members focused on driving exceptional service, value realization, and a world-class customer experience.&lt

column5: Flexibility: Develop and communicate a regional customer success strategy that aligns with evolving GTM strategies and company objectives. Adapt this strategy to address shifting customer needs and internal changes, ensuring consistent success outcomes.&lt

column3: Account Ownership: Provide supervision across several customers and partners, with a direct impact on the team???s overall results, through high-visibility, high-touch delivery strategies, technical account plan deployments, and product-level success plans.&lt

Risk Identification: Manages churn risk in their region either directly or through their teams by proactively identifying adoption issues, leveraging the Advanced Consulting Engineering (ACE) or Enterprise Services capabilities to address stalled adoption, where appropriate.&lt

Navigate Ambiguity: Demonstrate the ability to work through levels of ambiguity as the company transitions through GTM changes. Maintain focus on customer outcomes, ensuring that changes in internal strategy do not disrupt the customer experience.&lt

Data-Driven Insights: Establish and monitor key metrics and performance indicators (KPIs) to assess customer health, satisfaction, and product adoption. Use data to make informed strategic decisions and continuously improve the customer experience.&lt

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Sales, Product, Marketing, and Support teams to ensure seamless customer journeys, from onboarding to adoption, and to resolve any customer challenges swiftly and effectively. Drive alignment between these teams during GTM transitions.&lt

Business and Technical Acumen: Understand the unique complexity of the customers and segmentation of customers you serve and create the best path to full Tanium platform adoption and expansion, leveraging your understanding of not only the customer???s environment but also insights as to how to overcome obstacles to implement new technologies and integrations&lt

High-Performance Culture: Cultivate a culture of collaboration, learning, and excellence within the Customer Success team. Provide ongoing coaching, mentoring, and professional development to build a high-performing, customer-centric team.&lt

Customer Advocacy: Lead a team of trusted advisors to our most strategic enterprise customers, proactively addressing their challenges, both consultative and technical, and aligning their success with Tanium&#39
column4: s solutions. Ensure ???multi-threaded??? relationships across multiple levels of seniority and cross-functionally.&lt

column3: Growth and Expansion: Identify expansion opportunities within existing accounts and collaborate with Sales to develop and execute upsell and renewal strategies that drive revenue growth.&lt

Innovative Customer Success Programs: Proactively identify opportunities with the customer through key customer success initiatives such as customer feedback programs, business reviews, and success plans.&lt

Industry Leadership: Stay current with customer success best practices, industry trends, and evolving customer needs. Use this knowledge to innovate and develop the Customer Success function at Tanium.&lt
8 plus years of experience in Customer Success, Account Management, Sales, Renewals, or Service Management / Professional Services, preferably in a SaaS business model&lt

Experience in one or more of the following technical domains: Endpoint Security, Endpoint Support/ Troubleshooting, Incident Response, Systems Management, Utility Scripting (bash, PowerShell, VBScript, Python)&lt
Ability to master new concepts and technologies
column4: continually striving to master the Tanium platform and modules&lt

column3: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Collaboration Administrator with expertise in Microsoft 365 (M365), SharePoint, Exchange Online, Teams, and Slack Enterprise Grid to join the Modern Workplace team at Tanium. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and managing our collaboration infrastructure to ensure seamless communication and collaboration across our organization.&lt

column11: This is a hybrid position, which will require in person attendance a minimum three days each week in one of the following locations: Addison, TX

column3: Administration and management of M365, SharePoint, Slack, Exchange Online, Teams, and Entra ensuring optimal performance and availability.&lt
Manage user accounts, permissions, and access controls across platforms to ensure security and compliance.&lt
Manage and secure Enterprise Apps and App Registrations&lt
Implement monitoring and maintenance processes to proactively identify and resolve issues, ensuring the reliability and stability of collaboration systems.&lt
Maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations, processes, and procedures.&lt
Implement and enforce security measures to protect sensitive data and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.&lt
Ensure systems adhere to legal, regulatory, and internal compliance requirements.&lt
Participate in incident response efforts related to collaboration systems, including investigation, mitigation, and reporting of security incidents.&lt
Provide technical support and assistance to end-users, resolving issues related to M365 and Slack.&lt
Develop and deliver training programs to educate employees on the effective use of collaboration tools.&lt
Stay informed of upcoming changes that Microsoft is releasing to the M365 stack and take proactive action when needed.&lt
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices, proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.&lt
Work closely with other IT teams, business units, and stakeholders to ensure alignment of collaboration solutions with business objectives.&lt
Manage relationships with vendors and service providers, ensuring timely support and resolution of issues.&lt
Effectively communicate technical concepts and solutions to non-technical stakeholders, fostering a collaborative and productive working environment.&amp

column4: s Degree in Computer Science, IT or other relevant degree or equivalent work experience&lt

column3: Minimum of 6 years of experience with Microsoft 365 with at least 3 years of experience in designing, implementing, and managing collaboration solutions.&lt
Expertise in Microsoft 365 (M365) administration and configuration.&lt
Extensive experience with PowerShell for automation and task scripting&lt
In-depth knowledge of SharePoint architecture, customization, and administration.&lt
Comprehensive understanding of Microsoft Teams deployment, management, and troubleshooting.&lt
Configuration of Enterprise Applications, App Registration, SSO, and provisioning experience&lt
Deep knowledge and experience with Active Directory and Entra ID&lt
Experience working in the MS Purview and MS Defender portals&lt
Proficiency in Exchange Online administration and management.&lt
Experience with Slack Enterprise Grid administration and integrations.&lt
Understanding of Copilot integrations within M365 ecosystem&lt
Knowledge of mobile device management (MDM) and mobile application management (MAM) via Intune.&lt
Prior experience in a similar role within a large enterprise or global organization.&amp
Project management experience using tools like Jira&lt

column3: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Collaboration Administrator with expertise in Microsoft 365 (M365), SharePoint, Exchange Online, Teams, and Slack Enterprise Grid to join the Modern Workplace team at Tanium. column3: Administration and management of M365, SharePoint, Slack, Exchange Online, Teams, and Entra ensuring optimal performance and availability.&lt
Manage user accounts, permissions, and access controls across platforms to ensure security and compliance.&lt
Manage and secure Enterprise Apps and App Registrations&lt
Implement monitoring and maintenance processes to proactively identify and resolve issues, ensuring the reliability and stability of collaboration systems.&lt
Maintain comprehensive documentation of system configurations, processes, and procedures.&lt
Implement and enforce security measures to protect sensitive data and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.&lt
Ensure systems adhere to legal, regulatory, and internal compliance requirements.&lt
Participate in incident response efforts related to collaboration systems, including investigation, mitigation, and reporting of security incidents.&lt
Provide technical support and assistance to end-users, resolving issues related to M365 and Slack.&lt
Develop and deliver training programs to educate employees on the effective use of collaboration tools.&lt
Stay informed of upcoming changes that Microsoft is releasing to the M365 stack and take proactive action when needed.&lt
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices, proactively identifying opportunities for improvement.&lt
Work closely with other IT teams, business units, and stakeholders to ensure alignment of collaboration solutions with business objectives.&lt
Manage relationships with vendors and service providers, ensuring timely support and resolution of issues.&lt
Effectively communicate technical concepts and solutions to non-technical stakeholders, fostering a collaborative and productive working environment.&amp

column7: Tanium is looking for an experienced Senior Revenue Accountant who will be a key contributor to the Revenue Accounting team. This position will be responsible for driving key aspects of the revenue recognition process while ensuring compliance with GAAP standards and ASC 606 across all product and service revenue streams. You will partner cross-functionally with Deal Desk, Legal, and Sales during contract negotiations and advise on deal structures. Day-to-day, you will support the Revenue Accounting team by documenting technical revenue conclusions for customer contracts, preparing revenue-related accounting close deliverables, and helping to administer revenue operational processes.&lt

We are looking for a detail-oriented individual with excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Not only do you hold yourself to the highest level of integrity, but you are a self-starter and take ownership in your work product. This role would be ideal for someone with a background in audit and accounting and wants to grow their career in Revenue Recognition.&lt

column7: Tanium is looking for an experienced Senior Revenue Accountant who will be a key contributor to the Revenue Accounting team. This position will be responsible for driving key aspects of the revenue recognition process while ensuring compliance with GAAP standards and ASC 606 across all product and service revenue streams. You will partner cross-functionally with Deal Desk, Legal, and Sales during contract negotiations and advise on deal structures. Day-to-day, you will support the Revenue Accounting team by documenting technical revenue conclusions for customer contracts, preparing revenue-related accounting close deliverables, and helping to administer revenue operational processes.&lt

We are looking for a detail-oriented individual with excellent communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Not only do you hold yourself to the highest level of integrity, but you are a self-starter and take ownership in your work product. This role would be ideal for someone with a background in audit and accounting and wants to grow their career in Revenue Recognition.&lt

column3: As a Full-Stack Senior Software Engineer at Tanium, you will build and maintain best-of-breed products as part of a nimble development team. Tanium focuses on a customer engagement model and feedback process to ensure our products are designed the right way from the beginning. When new products ideas are identified, our software engineers design, develop, test, and deploy the products from the ground up, while iterating with product management and customers for feedback and input. This is a full-stack role that requires solid backend programming skills.&amp

column4: s products alongside an agile development team. Most backend is Golang and node.js.&lt

column7: Tanium, the industry???s leading provider of Autonomous Endpoint Management, is at the forefront of revolutionizing legacy approaches to managing complex security and technology environments. Our platform integrates IT operations, security, and risk into a single, comprehensive solution, delivering visibility, control, and protection at scale. Tanium is trusted by over half of the Fortune 100 and branches of the U.S. armed forces. &amp

As a Software Engineer II at Tanium, you will embark on an exciting new project focusing on building a robust data transport system and API standardization process. Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, you will ensure our services achieve top-tier performance, security, and scalability.&amp

column76: s products alongside an agile development team&lt

column71: Design, develop, and test new product ideas from the ground up while working with product management for feedback and input&lt

Work on agile teams that tackle foundational challenges in Tanium???s data services ecosystem???such as building and scaling the Connect service, which orchestrates secure and reliable delivery of endpoint data to external destinations like Splunk, S3, and SMB shares, and Gateway, which provides a unified GraphQL API layer for accessing Tanium platform data. These services enable external integrations, automate data flows, and support extensibility across modules, while maintaining operational transparency and robust RBAC controls&lt

column8: The Technical Project Manager???s role is to ensure execution of high profile and critically important projects and programs of work resulting in our customers deriving maximum value and utilization from the Tanium technology and services purchased. Technical Project Managers act as a link between the Tanium Account Team and the customer???s team at the project execution level. This role requires an individual to be both technically and tactically proficient with Enterprise IT tools, and to be able to operate Tanium on behalf of our customers. When on site or remotely supporting customers, the Technical Project Manager acts as a champion for Tanium best practices and as an advocate for the customer???s requirements with Tanium.&amp

Technical Project Managers act as part of a cross-functional Enterprise Services Team that complements the existing Sales, CSM, and Solution Engineering teams on accounts in two ways. First, by understanding and overcoming the short-term barriers to successful implementation/utilization of the Tanium product, while ensuring that best practices are being implemented to ensure a stable, available, and performant Tanium infrastructure. Second, by developing, managing, and reporting on a plan that prioritizes customer objectives, success criteria, and milestones along that path.&amp

column14: Independently (or with close collaboration with customers and Partners) own and manage complex technical projects with multiple dependencies, to meet stated and agreed objectives&amp

Develop and maintain project plans and schedules. Assist team members in planning, estimating, and controlling tasks. Ensure that interfaces are recognized and tasks are integrated. Perform critical path analysis and develop action plans to mitigate risk. Identify and implement alternative solutions. Delivery a variety of presentations in support of the objectives&amp

Drive maximum integration of Tanium into business processes and controls in order to achieve the value proposition and efficiency goals. In achieving this, Technical Project Managers are expected to understand and support technical integration of Tanium into our customer???s tool chains, business processes, and operational workflows.&amp
Tracking and reporting the health of assigned projects and, where appropriate, implementing get well plans.&amp
Assisting on other account level activities such as stakeholder mapping, maturity modelling, enhancement tracking, and project/engagement reporting&amp
Assist with practice development opportunities to mature the cross-functional nature of Enterprise Services.&amp
Contribute to documentation efforts, both internally and publicly facing&amp
Maintain a broad understanding of the Tanium solution and its capabilities&amp
Provide purpose, motivation, and direction to fellow members of the Customer Account Team&amp
10 + years of experience in technical project management or in a similar project leadership role&lt
Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP) and/or Project Management Professional (PMP) is a plus&amp
Track record of project management for long-term, multi-million dollar implementations&amp
Network/Cyber operations, Service Management, Professional Services, Customer Success, or Consulting backgrounds preferred&amp
Able to conduct briefings on large enterprise IT concepts
column15: familiar with general networking, network architectures, and database concepts&amp

column14: Consultative mindset combined with project-based execution while implementing novel solutions&amp
Ability to translate customers priorities, business objectives, process hindrances, and tactical operational difficulties into solution options using Tanium&amp
Interest in identifying and solving customers??? IT challenges&amp
Previous experience in a customer facing role, using interpersonal communication skills&amp
Willingness to always go above and beyond for the customer&amp
Team player with excellent organizational abilities&amp

column7: We are looking for a US Payroll Manager to join the Global Payroll team and lead the payroll process for Tanium???s US operations. Tanium currently operates payroll across 15 countries for 2,200+ employees and growing. The ideal candidate is experienced in US Payroll Operations and has a passion for innovative payroll solutions. This position will foster relationships with senior internal stakeholders by establishing and maintaining exceptional business relationships and working collaboratively with other organizational teams. The???candidate is expected to be hands-on as they complete day-to-day payroll operations, support new and existing pay programs, and drive process standardization, automation, and improvement.&amp

column3: Own the payroll processing of US salaried payroll for 1,400 employees and hourly payroll for 100 employees.&lt
Prepare payroll input files, process and review payroll outputs to verify accuracy and compliance, confirming that all data is properly recorded and processed according to company policies.&lt
Act as subject matter expert in US payroll providing valuable insights, guidance and assistance to other team members and internal stakeholders.&amp

Lead automation initiatives and process enhancements within the payroll department, collaborating cross-functionally with HR, IT, Legal, and Accounting to streamline and optimize payroll operations???including benefits administration and withholdings (e.g., leave of absence, employee benefits, 401k, FSA, etc.). Ensure adherence to best practices to minimize errors and maintain operational excellence.&lt
Assist with month-end close activities such as payroll journal entries and GL account reconciliations.&lt
Respond to employee inquiries and serve as liaison between employee and third-party providers.&lt
Audit, reconcile and fund 401k contributions associated with each payroll.&amp
column5: Research and resolve discrepancies in real time.&lt

column3: Review payroll and tax reporting and ensure accurate and timely filings with appropriate government authorities.&lt
Manage and track tax inquiries, amendments, adjustments and follow up with tax team as needed.&lt
Complete quarter-end and year-end reconciliations for tax filings and W-2 filings.&lt
Lead payroll related audits, such as Workers Compensation and 401k.&lt
Provide ad-hoc support and services on special projects and implementations as needed.&lt
Provide ad-hoc coverage and support on international payroll as needed.&lt
Minimum of 7 years of end-to-end payroll processing including companies with 1,800+ employees.&lt
Strong knowledge of payroll systems: UKG Pro and UKG WFM. NetSuite, SAP SuccessFactors, PwC Global Payroll and Workday are a plus.&lt
US payroll subject matter expertise ??? strong understanding of payroll processes, best practices, and thorough knowledge of payroll-related state, legal, tax, and compliance requirements.&lt
Strong verbal and written communication skills needed to interface and establish rapport with all levels of the organization including executive team members.&lt
A proactive, high-energy approach with exceptional management skills and meticulous attention to detail to deliver outstanding customer service.&lt
Knowledge of equity issues and how they relate to payroll reporting and tax (RSU, NQ, ISO)&lt
International payroll, including Canada, EMEA and/or APAC&lt
